title: Asus ZenBook 2018: Detailed displays, powerful portables | Trusted Reviews
description:
![The Asus ZenBook 13 \(UX333FN\) with the number keys on the touchpad
illuminated.](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Asus unveiled a ton of new ZenBook laptops at IFA 2018, all featuring
Intel’s new Whiskey Lake CPUs.**

Along with a revamp of the usual ZenBook range, which now features new 13, 14
and 15-inch versions, there are two new 13-inch and 15-inch ZenBook Flip
2-in-1s.

A refreshed ZenBook Pro, with a smaller 14-inch screen and new screenpad was
also on display, next to a revamped version of the entry-level Asus ZenBook S,
now with Core i5 and i7 Whiskey Lake options – whichever CPU option you go
for, you’re guaranteed gigabit Wi-Fi speeds (so long as your router supports
160MHz), faster video rendering times and better battery life.

There’s plenty of Zen to go around – check out our in-depth range guide to get
up to speed on what’s new with the 2018 ZenBook series and see which one’s
best for you.

**Related:[Intel Whiskey Lake and Amber Lake
](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/intel-whiskey-lake-amber-lake-3515645)**

![The new Asus ZenBook 15
\(UX533FD\).](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

## ZenBook 13 (UX333FN) and ZenBook 14 (UX433FN) and ZenBook 15 (UX533FD)

The new ZenBook 13 and 14 are all but identical in terms of specs, both
featuring the same processor options (Whiskey Lake Core i5 or i7), Nvidia
GeForce MX150 or Intel’s UHD Graphics 620 iGPU and 8GB or 16GB of LPDDR3 RAM.

echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to
enable it")

  * 

Both displays are Full HD (1920×1080). Asus says that all of the displays
feature 178 degree viewing angles and cover 72% of the NTSC colour gamut,
which is roughly equivalent to 100% of the sRGB gamut. We’ll know for sure
once we’ve got them in for testing.

All of these displays feature Asus’s ‘NanoEdge’ technology, which is
essentially a fancy way of saying that they’ve got very slim bezels; each new
ZenBook boasts a 95% screen-to-body ratio. You’ll also have the option of
taking a ZenBook with an anti-glare display, which knocks about 100g off of
the weight, not that this would matter much, as these are all pretty
lightweight laptops.

Asus’s new ErgoLift hinges have the advantage of lifting the laptop’s lower
half off of the desk surface, which is intended to make for a nicer typing
experience, as the keys are angled towards you, and allowing for better
cooling and audio performance.

The ZenBook 15 is similar to the 13.3-inch and 14-inch variants in a lot of
respects too. The main difference is that you’ll have the option of going for
a Full HD or 4K display. The battery is also significantly bigger, but if you
go for the 4K option, we expect that you won’t get as much mileage as you
would with the Full HD option. Large, detailed screens require a lot more
juice, after all.

**Related:[Asus ZenBook 15](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/asus-
zenbook-15-2018)**

## Asus ZenBook 13, 14, and 15 – Prices

Price details for the various 2018 Asus ZenBook iterations have not yet been
released.

## Asus ZenBook 13, 14, and 15 – Release date

Asus has not yet mentioned when the new 2018 ZenBook laptops will be going on
sale.

![The Asus ZenBook Flip 15 \(UX562\) in 'display'
mode.](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

## Asus ZenBook Flip 13 (UX362) and Flip 15 (UX562)

Both of these new 2-in-1s will feature the latest 8th gen Whiskey Lake CPUs
from Intel, the ErgoLift hinge for greater comfort, cooling and audio, and a
‘world-facing’ camera which will let you enjoy mixed/augmented reality
applications.

The camera is an optional extra for the ZenBook Flip 13, whereas it’s included
with the ZenBook 15 as standard. Some versions of the 13.3-inch ZenBook will
also come with Asus’s screenpad, a touchpad with additional context-dependent
controls, while none of the 15.6-inch versions will feature this.

Judging by the specs, the Flip 15 is the one that’ll be better suited to
creatives. You get two screen options – 4K and Full HD – both of which promise
excellent colour reproduction, but the 4K one is PANTONE validated. Both
options come with a discrete GPU (an Nvidia GeForce GTX 1050 Max-Q) with 2GB
of GDDR5 VRAM.

Finally, there will be a dual-storage version of the ZenBook Flip 15, where
you’re promised the best of both worlds, fast SSD speeds and high HDD
capacity.

Both of the 2018 ZenBook Flip 13 and Flip 15 feature NanoEdge near bezel-less
displays and are roughly 10 per cent smaller than their predecessors.

![The Asus ZenBook Flip 13 \(UX362\) in standard laptop
mode.](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

| **ZenBook Flip 13** | **ZenBook Flip 15**  
---|---|---

(3840×2160) touchscreen, Delta-E ≦2 /

15.6-inch LED-backlit FHD (1920×1080) touchscreen, Delta-E ≦3

PANTONE Validated

GDDR5 VRAM  
Memory | 8GB / 16GB 2133MHz LPDDR3 | 16GB 2400MHz DDR4  
Storage | 256GB, 512GB PCIe SSD / 256GB, 512GB SATA3 SSD | 512GB PCIe SSD /

256GB, 512GB SATA3 SSD and

2TB SATA HDD 5400RPM  
  
Wireless Connectivity | Dual-band 802.11ac gigabit-class Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0
| Dual-band 802.11ac gigabit-class Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0  
Ports | (With world-facing camera) 2 x Type-C, USB 3.1 Gen 1, 3.5mm headphone
jack / (Without world-facing camera) 2 x USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-C, USB 2.0 Type-A,
HDMI, 3.5mm headphone jack | USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-C (data transfer only), USB
3.1 Gen 1 Type-A, USB 2.0, Standard HDMI, SD card reader, 3.5mm headphone jack  
Battery | 50Wh 3-cell lithium-polymer (battery life not yet specified) | 57Wh
4-cell lithium-polymer / 86Wh 6-cell lithium-polymer battery (SSD version

Dimensions | 305 x 169 x 16.9 mm | 357 x 226 x 20.9mm  
Weight | 1.3kg | 1.9kg  
  
## Asus ZenBook Flip 13 and Flip 15 – Prices

Asus has yet to talk about prices for the new ZenBook Flips.

## Asus ZenBook Flip 13 and Flip 15 – Release date

Equally, we don’t know when the Asus ZenBook Flip 13 and Flip 15 will be
hitting shelves.

**Related:[Best laptop](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-
laptops-3431966)**

## ZenBook Pro 14 (UX480)

As the name implies, this laptop is aimed at professionals, photographers and
designers in particular.

The 14-inch Full HD display apparently covers the entire eRGB gamut and it’s
also PANTONE verified, which gives you some indication of its colour accuracy.
Without a colorimeter to hand we’ve not yet been able to verify these claims,
but that’s something we wouldn’t normally do until we got hold of a review
sample anyway. The 16:9 aspect ratio suggests that it’ll be well suited to
video playback and streaming.

Rounding out its pro credentials is an Nvidia GeForce GTX 1050 Max-Q dGPU –
the same one you get with the new ZenBook Flips – but this time you have the
option of taking 2GB or 4GB of GDDR5 VRAM, depending on your working needs.

The display and the GPU combined with the promised boost to rendering times
that you should get with a Whiskey Lake CPU means that powering through video
edits on Premiere Pro ought to be a breeze.

We saw a ZenBook Pro 14 (UX480) earlier in the year at Computex, alongside a
larger [ZenBook Pro 15](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/zenbook-pro)
(UX580) sibling. But this was before Intel had revealed its new 8th gen laptop
processors.

Asus has confirmed that the 2018 ZenBook Pro 14 will come with Whiskey Lake
CPUs, but the jury’s currently out whether the Pro 15 will get the same
treatment. We’d assume so, but we’ll wait until we have confirmation.

## Asus ZenBook Pro 14 – Specifications

| **ZenBook Pro 14**  
---|---  
Display | 14-inch FHD, 16:9 aspect ratio  
CPU | Core i7-8565U, Core i5-8265U  
Graphics | Nvidia GTX 1050 Max-Q, 2GB / 4GB GDDR5 VRAM  
Memory | 8GB/16GB 2400MHz DDR4  
Storage | 128GB / 256GB SATA 3 SSD

256GB / 512GB PCIe® x2 SSD

1TB PCIe x4 SSD  
  
Wireless Connectivity | Dual-band 802.11ac gigabit-class Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0  
Ports | USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C, USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-A, USB 2.0, Standard HDMI,
3.5mm headphone jack  
Battery | 70Wh 4-cell lithium-polymer (battery life not yet specified)  
Dimensions | 225 x 323 x 17.9mm  
Weight | 1.6kg  
  
**Related:**[ **Best Intel processor: Core i3, i5, i7 and i9
explained**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-intel-processor-3517396)

## Asus ZenBook Pro 14 – Prices

No mention of price for the ZenBook Pro 14, but _Trusted Reviews_ understands
that its 15-inch equivalent was expected to be priced £1900 and £2200 for
models with 8th gen Core i7 and Core i9 CPUs. This may be an indicator of what
you can expect to pay for the ZenBook Pro 14.

## Asus ZenBook Pro 14 – Release date

We don’t have so much as hint of a rumour of a whisper about the ZenBook Pro
14’s release date just yet.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

## ZenBook S (UX391FA)

We saw a [ZenBook S](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/zenbook-s) at
Computex, but the one Asus had on show at IFA is a revamped Whiskey Lake-
equipped version.

A key benefit of ditching the i5-8250U and i7-8550U for newer models is
apparently better battery life.

A battery drain test saw a ZenBook S with Whiskey Lake Core i5-8265U and the
screen dipped to 150 nits last 20 hours when playing video via the Windows
Movie & TV app. That’s a great figure, so let’s hope that this bears up in our
testing and the i7 version is similarly impressive.

Aside from a decent battery, what do you get with the ZenBook S? The choice of
FHD and 4K screens, all of which promise 100% sRGB colour gamut coverage, a
very light 1kg body, and the same ErgoLift hinge which should at once make
typing easier and stop the ZenBook S’s base from getting too hot.

As the ZenBook S represents a stripped back, entry-level equivalent to the
main ZenBooks and the more powerful ZenBook Pro, something’s got to give and
that something is ports. There’s no HDMI ports or microSD or SD card readers,
just three USB ports, all of which support display as well as power and data
transfer.

We’re hoping that the price is going to be nicer to reflect the smaller size
and fewer connectivity options. In the meantime, while we’re waiting on price
info and release dates, here are the specs:

**ZenBook S – Specifications**

| **ZenBook S**  
---|---  
Display | 13.3-inch LED-backlit 4K UHD (3840 x 2160) 16:9 standard touchscreen
/

13.3-inch LED-backlit Full HD (1920 x 1080) 16:9 standard touchscreen /

13.3-inch LED-backlit Full HD (1920 x 1080) 16:9 anti-glare display  
  
CPU | Core i7-8565U, Core i5-8265U  
Graphics | Integrated Intel UHD Graphics 620  
Memory | 8GB / 16GB 2133MHz LPDDR3  
Storage | 1TB / 512GB PCIe 3.0 x4 SSD /

256GB PCIe x2 SSD  
  
Wireless Connectivity | Dual-band 802.11ac gigabit-class Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0  
Ports | 2 x USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C (Thunderbolt 3), USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-C, 3.5mm
headphone jack  
Battery | 50Wh 3-cell lithium-polymer (up to 20 hours video playback on Core
i5 version)  
Dimensions | 305 x 169 x 16.9 mm  
Weight | 1.3kg  
  
_Note: We weren’t able to spot any models on Asus’s IFA stand, so for now
we’re mainly going from the spec sheet and our notes from back in June._

**Excited about the new Asus’s new Whiskey Lake-powered ZenBook laptops?
Meditate with us Twitter @TrustedReviews**
